content.webTitle: High power prices fuel British Energy profits

fields.headline: High power prices fuel British Energy profits
fields.bodyText: Soaring power prices helped provide a £64m first-quarter profit at British Energy following January's financial restructuring. The nuclear power firm said it had sold some 85% of its planned output for the year to March 31 at an average £31.80 per megawatt hour. In July, British Energy had fixed around 75% of its planned output for the 2005/06 financial year at an average contracted price of £29.80. The company said levels could have been better were it not for problems at its Hartlepool and Heysham 1 facilities, which the firm hopes will be back to normal later next month.
